titleStmt.title: The Instrument, or, Writing of association that the true Protestants of England entred into in the reign of Queen Elizabeth while her life, and the Protestant religion, by hellish popish plots was attempted : together with the act of Parliament then for confirmation, and several observations thereupon : usefully accommodated to our present day.

The Instrument, or, Writing of association that the true Protestants of England entred into in the reign of Queen Elizabeth while her life, and the Protestant religion, by hellish popish plots was attempted : together with the act of Parliament then for confirmation, and several observations thereupon : usefully accommodated to our present day.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament. Act ... to preserve the Queen's person and the Protestant religion.

notesStmt.note: Imperfect: lacking p. 1-8; best copy available for photographing.
Reproduction of original in Harvard University Library.
